name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Bristol

reviews.text: I stayed for one night at this hotel with my 3 girlfriends. We took the opportunity to do some Christmas shopping and the hotel is well positioned for shopping at Cabot Circus. All four of us were very impressed with this hotel on a number of fronts. Check in was fine and we were greeted with a complimentary glass of mulled wine which was very pleasant. Our rooms were lovely and we had good views of the harbour. We all thought the beds were very comfortable and had a good nights sleep, no noise at all. We decided to stay at the hotel for dinner as it was so cold outside and we were slightly nervous as hotel restaurants are so variable. We need not have worried as the service and food were very good. The breakfast was delicious and lots of choice. Other reviewers had commented on the food being luke warm and I have to say this was not the case for us, everything was piping hot. We would definitely come back to this hotel. I always check on tripadvisor before booking anywhere and I was impressed that the manager always responds to negative comments. We actually spoke to the manager as we were leaving the breakfast area and I am not surprised that this hotel is so good. Here you have a manager that cares about customers and does his utmost to make sure that everything is as it should be. The only slight negative comment would be that we were a little cold in the bar area during the evening but the manager said he was well aware of this problem and it was being looked into. If you are looking for a central hotel to stay in when visiting Bristol you would not be disappointed with the Radisson Blu
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night recently. This a very nice hotel for business or pleasure. It is located about 10-12 mins walk from the Bristol train station. Several shops and restaurants are within a 2 mins walk.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: The room itself was spacious and comfortable. The view of the city was amazing with floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom was really nice also. I did manage to have a drink at the lobby bar and the price and quality were good also.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel and would absolutely stay here again.
reviews.title: Dependably comfy hotel close to Bristol Quayside
Disappointing
reviews.text: Note to foreign travelers: UK hotels require a passport upon check in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We treated ourselves to a two stay stay for operas at the Hippodrome. Such bliss not to have to drive home, just walk across the road. Valet parking at £23 a night is worth it for convenience and peace of mind.We walked to the SS Great Britain in less than twenty minutes. Buffet breakfast had plenty of choice and was of good quality. Room on the 13th floor had a splendid view over the city, though I agree that two lifts are insufficient for so tall a building. We asked for a twin bedded room, which turned out to be two beds pushed together, with one duvet. Room lighting was very poor (and my request for a replacement light bulb in one of lamps went unheeded). The room door spring sticks out, so you can only partly open the drawers in the clothes cupbard...unintelligent positioning. The bath mat offered as an extra should be in the room as standard... my husband slipped over twice. Staff in the restaurant didn't seem to be very organised....the Rapido service offered pre theatre was anything but.... the waitress spent a quarter of an hour talking to two people who weren't even eating that night before giving us our menus and then the food took another 25 minutes to arrive. The following night the staff busied themselves and the chef took our order personally, so I guess someone had had words. And the food was good. We'd stay again (but bring our own desk light).
reviews.title: Theatre package stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a really nice one night stay at the Radisson Blu. I've vistied Bristol on numerous occassions and really wanted to stay here, and my girlfirend booked it as a surprise for my birthday.
reviews.title: Great Location, great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wasn't let down. The hotel itself is beatifully decorated and in a fantastic location. The room was lovely and the bed was super comfy.
reviews.title: Luxury accommodation

reviews.text: Check in was a breeze, and service was great. When we got to our room, there was no remote control for the the TV. I called reception and they immediately sent someont to our room and resolved the issue promtly with no dramas.
reviews.title: Chalk and cheese

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, our room was not facing the lovely harbour but instead we ernjoyed a view of the wall of the next building. However, this didn't fuss me too much as we were only using the hotel to sleep at for one night and have breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and good nights sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and me partner visited the Radisson Blu for one night in October 2012. We couln't have asked for more. We got the room at a great rate from a website and we were very pleasently surprised. The hotel and staff were lovely and the room was great, very large with everything you would expect. The hotel is in a great situation and we enjoyed an evening in Bristol and then walked to Cabot Circus. Very good in every way
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived there was a queue of 8 people to check-in. Never before have I had to wait 25 minutes to check into a hotel. The room was nice enough, but we were staying in a business class room. There were no special touches. Disappointed.
reviews.title: Expected more

reviews.text: Clean, modern hotel in a great location. My room was on the 13th floor looking over the city, so I didnt bother closing the curtains as the floor to ceiling windows afforded me a great night time view including the illuminated clock on an office block roof a few streets away which was dead handy!
reviews.title: Plenty to like, not much to dislike

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quiet room - only evidence of outside noise was the few occassional police sirens. Good modern bathroom. Big comfy bed. So, very little to dislike about the room itself. It would really be petty to find fault with the wardrobe door that didnt open fully as the room door hinge mechanism prevented it from doing so, or the slightly gloomy feel at night in line with most modern hotels as the lightling is best described as "moody".
reviews.title: 17 floor raddison suite....

reviews.text: Breakfast wasnt quite so great though, and this was the one let down. Food choice itself is fine, but having selected the cooked breakfast from the buffet it was pretty lukewarm at best. The cold plates really didn't help.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights while in Bristol for our son's wedding. We had a large, well furnished room on the 11th floor. The bed was enormous and comfortable with a large en suite bathroom. The only thing I didn't like was the shower over the bath. I do prefer a separate shower. All went well during our stay there was an excellent buffet breakfast with a huge choice of hot and cold food. However the check out morning was poor. One lift was broken and there was chaos with people trying to get down to the ground floor to check out. At the Reception desk there was a long queue.
reviews.title: Lovely rooms but.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Message to the hotel. Please do not put staff onto the desk whose knowledge of English is not up to dealing with anything other than a normal check out. Mine was quite complicated as I had booked multiple rooms, some of which were prepaid and some not. Oh dear ! The manager took over but was a disappointing end to a nice stay.
reviews.title: Standards slipping

reviews.text: I know the Radisson Blu chain very well and have had excellent stays in both Bristol and Cardiff in the past but the Bristol hotel is no where near where it should be.
reviews.title: Good business hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: The room had tea and coffee making facilities but no milk. The bathroom had a tissue dispenser but it was empty. There was no robe in the room however there was a single slipper left for me in the wardrobe. None of these I felt were worth complaining about but just a sign that things are slipping slightly.
reviews.title: Good price - poor lifts

reviews.text: What I did find more annoying was the attitude of the staff. The gentleman who checked me into the hotel was rude as were the staff in the restaurant at breakfast. If you are going to operate a seat and serve yourself policy you should at least tell people who come in for breakfast. When I asked where I could get some tea it was like I'd asked for the moon on a stick. I left without eating so can't comment on quality.
reviews.title: Good hotel

description: The Radisson Blu Hotel, Bristol is a tastefully designed, eye-catching building in the centre of the city, close to the old town, and most of the city's cultural treasures, Museums, Theatres and the new Concert Hall. Colston Hall. Encased in shimmering glass, this impressive Bristol hotel’s iconic high-rise structure is an impressive landmark above the city skyline. Choose from 176 rooms and suites with deluxe amenities like Free high-speed, wireless Internet; most of the rooms feature expansive views of the beautiful waterfront. The on-site Filini Restaurant hosts the daily Super Breakfast Buffet as well as serving delicious Mediterranean cuisine for lunch and dinner. Five modern and well-equipped conference rooms are available for hosting personal and business events.
